Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and nice stuff”
Reviews.Author: travel M
Reviews.Content: This is a great apartment building and very spacious for somebody travelling with the family.They save a delicious breakfast and tasty Cappuccino and Hot Chocolate in the morning.The apartment building is couple minutes to Saint Peters Square and Ottaviano train station which will take you to the rest of Rome.The stuff are very pleasant and they speak English as well so you will not have trouble if your Italian is not that good.But they appreciate when you try to speak Italian.The bathroom cubicle can be a little smaller if you are this tall and huge person but you can manage.The cleaning lady/guy do the cleaning daily and fresh bed sheets and towel are handed daily.It is very pleasant and you are guaranteed a comfortable staying.The downside is there were some construction going on when we were there but i think this is seasonal.The apartment is very close to the road, I mean very close but you might not hear the traffic after you are tired walking around in Rome the whole day.So when you are getting off the apartment be extremely careful if you have little kids.The traffic do not yield to pedestrians at all.The sisters who have a condo across the Aurelia residency usually ring the bells once in the morning but that is a Rome culture they ring bells all the time you will hear that even when walking in downtown Rome close to any church.

Reviews.Title: “Aurelia Residence treats you like family”
Reviews.Author: PISTONS15U
Reviews.Content: My sisters and daughters stayed at Aurelia for three nights and it was fabulous. They treated us like family the entire time. The rooms were very clean and comfortable with nice showers. The breakfasts were great and they fix you a capacinno every morning! There is also a large filtered water container which came in handy. There is a busy road out front but if you cross over, it is just a short walk to the Vatican. In business, people make the difference. You will NEVER find more helpful and sincere people anywhere else. Raffaelo and Ferdinand were so very helpful when our flight lost our luggage. (on a side note...do not EVER fly Alitalia!!) They went above and beyond for us with the claims department at the airport. Gennaro ended up dropping everything and driving us to the airport to get our luggage. He walked in with me and showed me right where to go. We then hired him to drive us to Florence and it was a safe, fast and comfortable drive. Overall, a very positive experience! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “We loved Aurelia Residence!”
Reviews.Author: ArmyWife1999
Reviews.Content: My family (two 40-something adults, a 9-year-old boy, and his 79-year-old Grandmother) loved Aurelia Residence - we will definitely stay there again when we return to Rome. We were greeted warmly upon our arrival and were immediately upgraded to a larger room (two bedrooms, two baths, both baths with stand-up showers). It was a full apartment with two terraces, an eat-in kitchen, another large table in the living area, and more than enough space for four people. The staff was amazing - Genaro made us delicious cappuccinos in the morning and made us feel like family. We were there in November so were not able to have breakfast on the rooftop terrace, but the breakfast room is very nice. It was wonderful to be able to walk to St. Peter's Basilica, and we had no trouble finding taxis nearby. We decided to taxi everywhere due to Grandma's mobility issues, so can't comment about other transportation. Despite its being so close to the Vatican, our taxi fares around town were very reasonable. The only thing we did not like was having to cross the busy road outside the front gate to get to the sidewalk, but we had no issues with that either - the cars will actually stop if you are crossing the road. We were nervous but ended up having no close calls whatsoever. A lovely stay at a lovely hotel - a keeper!

Reviews.Title: “Experience Rome like a Roman!!!”
Reviews.Author: supertaster74
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Residence Aurelia for 4 nights and it was a positive experience. We felt like locals since the place was like an apartment not just a hotel room. The service was excellent and we loved having breakfast every morning on the rooftop terrace. Genaro made the best capuccinos we had the whole time we were in Italy!! There were just a couple things we didnt like. The mattress was extremely hard and the uneven, the shower too small and the blowdryer only worked when I had my finger pressing the button, which made it difficult to use a brush to style my hair. We really liked the place overall and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect base from which to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: Susie C
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on its very competitive price compared to other hotels of the same grade, and also due to a number of very good reviews - and we were not disappointed. On arrival we were upgraded, and the staff could not have been more helpful in settling us in. We used the hotel as a base from which to walk to various amazing locations in Rome, and it was very special to pass the Vatican on our way out and back every day. Highly recommended for a slightly quieter base away from the centre, with good local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: midnightchatter
Reviews.Content: Good location if you want to walk. Rough, busy road to walk down to main roads. Close to Vatican. Fernando at the front was great...very helpful. Had an issue in our room and problem was fixed right away! Good breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Aleta M
Reviews.Content: Huge apartments, great staff, amazing price. Granted its not really really close to attractions other than the Vatican, but its very comfy, very clean and very cheap so 10 mins on a bus or abit of a walk is worth it. The staff are incredibly helpful, really lovely people. Would 100% stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great apartment in the heart of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: loriglover
Reviews.Content: In August 2011 I stayed at Aurelia with my husband and 2 teenage boys. The apartment was very spacious- 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, a living room, dining area and full kitchen. I have family in Rome so the extra space was really appreciated when it came to entertaining. We had 10 people over for dinner- it was like entertaining at home. The service was wonderful too! Fernando was extremely helpful. The breakfast on the roof terrace was a treat - croissonts with Nutella, cappucino and listening to the bells of St. Peter's. Defintily a great location for a family to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great accomodation good location fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: chaucerclan
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from our first visit to rome, what a fantastic place to visit,although a few days is not enough, so we will definately have to return to see more of rome. Our stay was at the fantastic Aurelia residence we had a lovely apartment, well equipped, very spacious and outside space to enjoy a glass of italian wine what more could you ask for. The location of the apartment was excellant for getting to the vatican a short walk down the road,also bus routes to all the sites was also just down the road. We did quite alot of walking to the close by atractions and the food locally was delicous and the AD ARTE resteraunt reccomended by Raffaele was excellent,also my daughter would like to say that Captain Cone did the best ice cream in the area. We would also like to thank Genaro for serving a wonderful breakfast on the rooftop balcony, delicous,yummy and great cappucino.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place in Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: aegpres
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Aurelia for the past 7 days in unit 8A and really enjoyed our stay. The property is outstanding for a long stay in Rome. There were just two of us but I wouldn't even have an issue with bringing our kids here to stay with us the next time. Rooms are large, even the bathroom large (shower was a little small, but oh well). Breakfast in the morning was very well done, and the service is friendly (far better then I can say for Rome overall where good service is very hard to find). Market is close by, about a 5-10 minute walk, as are many bus stops. We also stopped in a local pub called McQueens that we really liked that is only a 5 minute walk away - it is on Aurelia towards the Vatican. You can also walk to the Vatican from here in no time at all, other main sites in Rome will require a bus ride but still the overall location is not that bad. Wi-Fi was free and in the apartments so that was very nice. One word of warning, be very careful on the buses and subway for pickpockets - my wife had someone take her iPhone today - not fun!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place where I`d like to stay once more”
Reviews.Author: Olga S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2011 with friends and loved this place very much. It has an excellent location, nearby Vatican and other Roman historical places where you can go by walk. It is a cosy and quiet place. I think it is suitable for different kinds of stays - solo, family or friends. Large comfortable rooms with kitchen, good breakfast on the last floor terrace with a view of the roofs of Vatican. I admired the greenery everywhere on the territory, authentic inner yards. The staff was very helpful (can help with maps, sightseeng etc). If I have a chance to visit Rome once more this place would be a perfect choice for it. It is cosy, romantic and here you can feel the atmosphere of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A place in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: greenthea
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Rome was especially nice due to staying in this marvellous residence. The location is just perfect, a walking distance from the main attractions of Vatican. Spacious appartments, pleasant atmosphere, very hospitable staff are what I can highly recommend. Great breakfast on the roof with marvelous views of Rome makes staying in this place especially enjoyable and romantic. I am also a great fan of greenery and flowers, so I was pleased to find plenty of it in a lovely yard and in a terrace on the roof. Only positive impressions!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in all aspects”
Reviews.Author: Michaela L
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in the hottest week of August and had a real good time. Location is super, wheather you want to go sightseeing or even take a couple of cooling hours off at the beach. The train station for going to the beach is only 5 min away! The App. was spacious, well equipped, modern, clean and the AC worked well! Breakfast at the roof top Garden is really special and starts the day with the perfect mediteranean feeling. If you are a light sleeper you might find the close by trains in the morning a bit disturbing, but you are in Rome after all! Noise is part of the deal in any Italian city. The bus stop is right in front of the App. complex, there is a big supermarket close by and St. Peter is literally just around the corner. Another tip: the airport pick up is absolutly worth its money. Special thanks to the extremly helpful front desk staff Raffaele and Ferdinando. You can really ask them anything, they will try to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. We had a real good time and will definitly come back again.

Reviews.Title: “The big family at the Residence”
Reviews.Author: vilmaortega
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome during our summer vacations this year. We stayed a the Residence, and this was the best experience, ever , compared to our other experiences in Europe. We were 12 in total, 3 families, we rented 3 apart, and we were extra comfortable. The staff was very kind, they arranged for us the transportation, oriented about sightseeing, restaurants, everything we needed. Paula, she was fluent in spanish, made everything easier for us, she is great! Our party included kids, seniors, teenagers and all were pleased and comfortable, we had restaurants, pizzerias, laundry, fruit market, pharmacies, supermarkets, bakeries and the Vatican walking distance! The apartments are big, clean!, the bathroom is ok, the shower is a little small for those "heavy weights" but not much a problem, rooms have good a/c, cable tv, full equipped kitchens on big apart and kitchenettes on smaller, breakfast was very good. We give an A+ to the residence, would stay there in our next visit to Rome and we strongly recommend it to our friends!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Apartments”
Reviews.Author: Maria B
Reviews.Content: Three female family members stayed here for a long weekend at the beginning of August 2011. Booked from the internet, having been looking for somewhere bigger than your average hotel room. Beautiful apartment, we booked a one bedroom but were upgraded to a two bedroom on arrival. Friendly staff and very helpful with maps, sightseeing tips etc. Breakfast on the roof terrace was wonderful, it was hard to leave the terrace and actually go sightseeing. Only a few minutes walk to thew Vatican, and stops for tour buses. Bought a 48 hour ticket for open top bus, lets you hop on and off all weekend. Saved on some of the walking. Would recommend the Aurelia to all types of tourist, couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific accomodation and staff!”
Reviews.Author: ANGELA S
Reviews.Content: Great accomodation, excellent location for the Vatican. Lovely breakfast and very nice staff. Open top buses are great 48 hrs hop on and off for 18 euro.lets you take in all of the main tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “5-minute walk to St. Peter's Basilica, luxurious decor, personable staff!”
Reviews.Author: ceras77
Reviews.Content: Booked through Shell Vacations Club, this property exceeded our expectations. We were traveling with our two children (20 months & 3 years) and knew there would be a kitchen...but what we got was a fully stocked apartment! Two full sized bedrooms with ample wall cabinet space/storage; 1 1/5 bath and the kitchen was roomy. Two balconies, high ceilings. We felt like our vacation residence was a vacation in and of itself! Very peaceful setting, abundant floral vegetation around the property; right next to train tracks which were heard occasionally but never a nuisance. A/C in the bedrooms (huge perk). Our master bedroom had what appeared to be two twin beds (Europe sizes) pushed together to make a queen. Not the best rest, but we were so worn out each day from all the walking we fell fast asleep! Breakfast is over the top abundant! Service staff make to order your coffee/espresso; the buffet offers something for everyone: fresh fruits, pastries to make you die and go to Heaven; hard boiled eggs; cereals (our favorite was granola-by far the best I've ever had); breads; cheeses...you get the idea! It was easy to overeat. Breakfast is served on the top floor of building which provides a tranquil patio dining spot, excellent views! Be sure to look both ways when crossing the street to get to the sidewalk-you know those Roman drivers are FAST! A quick 5-10 minute walk and you are at St. Peter's Piazza! Finally, the staff are extremely hospitable-you can tell they enjoy sharing the gems of not only their property but also the city! We can't say enough great things! You can do laundry on-site-4 Euros; access is 24 hours. Very safe property-you are given a gate for the entry into the driveway/piazza of the residence and then the keys for the actual building & room! Highly recommend this property-very comfortable, met all our needs and more! PS. Into technology, this place offers free wi-fi and excellent satellite TV!

Reviews.Title: “From San Diego with love”
Reviews.Author: Godjul
Reviews.Content: I would like to acknowledge Ferdinand E and Genaro for their great hospitality to me, my family and my friend Daisy. They made us feel at ease and their willingness to assist in every way went above and beyond. Thank you and we will definitely stay there next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Retort666
Reviews.Content: Accommodation was good and spacious apartment style (it's not an ordinary hotel, it's serviced apartments), breakfast on the roof was great. Staff were friendly and helpful. Short walk (up hill) from bus stop and near to some train line noise, but neither concerned us.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely apartment, not great location...”
Reviews.Author: Petsters
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights with 2 young children. The apartment was VERY spacious, clean and well appointed. Breakfast was delightful and the service was great. On the downside, the location wasn't great. We were walking distance from the Vatican, but the area felt a little seedy. The apartment was in a gated complex with the gate right on the road. It was tricky with young children getting in and out of taxis, but that's probably the norm in the rest of Rome. We used taxis to get around, and it was roughly 10 euros generally to get to the main central attractions. There is a train line in the back garden which is quite noisy. The people above us were also immensely noisy - the noise of the blinds opening, and furniture moving(like chairs being pushed in and out at a table) was enough to wake me through the night at least 3 times a night. I would reccommend this place, but don't expect a peaceful nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families. Unique and wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: Njeim-BouKaram
Reviews.Content: We experienced Aurelia Residence for 5 days, and should admit that we had a wonderful stay! As a group of 20 persons, we thought initially it would be difficult to find a good accommodation that can meet requirements. We booked 4 apartments for that (Toscanini, Vivaldi, Rossini and Puccini), nice decorations, rooms large enough to meet our demand, fully equipped kitchen and a nice balcony for a morning Tea. The reception was quite warm; Raffaele and Ferdinand were very helpful, informing us about all the touristic details of the area. Both communicate in English, and this was very crucial for us. Wireless internet connection was also available. An early morning breakfast, gathering our big family, was really joyful on the rooftop, from where you can see Saint Peter’s Dome as well as other nice surrounding buildings. The food was all right, just enough to start nicely a tour in Rome. All the personnel, including Generro, made us feel at home. As we were planning for our marriage, held in Saint Peter’s Basilica, all the staff was supportive. Starting with a nice reception for the bride, flower bouquets in her room and along the entrance of the residence. Generro again, took us with his SUV to the Basilica, a 5 mn trip as the location is very close to Vatican, not more than 10 mn walking time. The post-wedding lunch was celebrated on the rooftop, also beautifully decorated by the staff. The catering was exceptional, a traditional Italian lunch, as ordered, highly appreciated by the guests. Photoshoots with St Peter’s Dome behind were also special. The only inconvenience found was its close location to a train station, with an annoying sound from now and then, unless sitting inside. In conclusion, Aurelia Residence is highly recommended, especially for groups larger than 3 persons; a warm place where you’ll feel at home, close to the Vatican, with a helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: pghguy
Reviews.Content: I was little concerned regarding what to expect here. But in the end it proved to be very comfortable. I was looking for a reasonably priced place, reasonably close to the Centro Area that also had an outside space. After extensive research and eliminating many different options either because of cost, poor reviews from previous guests or lack of amenities I found this place. Initially the cost was 160euro per night ($215.00)....but ended up getting the reservation for 112euro ($145.00). I was ready to book at the 160euro. On arrival we were "upgraded" from a one bedroom to a 2 bedroom unit. Since there were only 2 of us the upgrade wasn't very useful. But having a room to store the luggage and throw dirty clothes into was nice. The rest of the apartment consisted of a livingroom/diningroom/kitchen combination. Very spaceous. A tad outdated, a little worn. But in better shape than most hotels I have stayed in when in Rome or Europe for that matter. Our apartment was located on the third floor and had a large balcony with outdoor furniture. The biggest drawback is that the apartment/balcony was a stone's throw from the railroad tracks. We learned to live with the noise, but it certainly wasn't quiet. The apt. is very convenient for visiting the Vatican, just 10 minutes to St. Peter's Square. Entrance to the museum is on the opposite side so still a bit of a walk. The city center is a bit of a walk. Very doable. But could understand if someone thought it was still a bit out of the way. Easy to catch a taxi at St. Peter's as well buses. We were there 5 days and walked into and back from the city twice a day. The apartments are part of a complex where many of the apartments are privately owned. The apt. managers try to give it an least some "hotel amentities" with a part-time reception area and a morning breakfast buffet. It seems to work well especially if you are not needy and don't require the assistence of a hotel front desk for directions and recommendations 24/7. The breakfast buffet is very basic, but adequate. The best part is that it is served on the roof-top terrace. There is a view of St. Peters' Dome...but just a top view. The people who staff the reception area are very friendly and very welling to help if you need it. There are several restaurants within easy walking distance as well as places to pick up "panino", pizza, and wine if you care to bring it back to the apartment. Air-condition did not work very well. But luckily weather turned cooler and it wasn't necessary. Hot water tank was turned down so although plenty of hot water, it just wasn't very hot. All in all, the apt. was comfortable, it was great to have the extra space, it was close enough to the Centro to walk and best of all....extremely price friendly. I would certainly consider this place again the next time I travel to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Classy comfortable and spacious apartment hotel”
Reviews.Author: NikiNiki
Reviews.Content: If you are travelling with a group of friends or family then this is a good option. You get a whole apartment to yourself, even a small kitchen where you can prepare some simple food. The rooms are all very clean and the reception staff are on hand to answer any questions you might have about room. During the summer breakfast is served on the roof terrace, there is plenty of things to choose from and the setting is lovely. You are very close to the Vatican, just a few minutes walk. But you are far from anywhere else in Rome. There is one good restaurant close by called Goose which was recommended to us by the hotel. Otherwise there's nothing in the immediate area which is the only negative thing I have to say about this place in addition to the fact that you have to pay a small fee for wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Aurelia Residence is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: apkala
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful apartment style facility which is very close to The Vatican. We walked to most locations. A wonderful breakfast is included in the price of the apartment. The staff is lovely - especially the reception/office (Ferdinand and Rafael) and breakfast staff (Gennaro - you can book tours directly with Gennaro at a good price with very personal service). You can also book tours directly with the reception staff. Our trip started out very badly with the previous apartment canceling the day before we left the USA (and keeping our deposit). Traveling with my sister, mother and friend of the family - we were very concerned. Ferdinand and Aurelia Residence came to our rescue and saved our trip. Upon arrival, they even upgraded our apartment to a two bedroom, air-conditioned unit. Simply wonderful. The location is close to the train tracks. However, it is very quiet. I am a light sleeper and the train noise was never a problem. When I return to Roma, I will stay at Aurelia Residence.

Reviews.Title: “Apartment living in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel3344
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 2 rooms at the Aurelia Residence from June 24 to July 3, 2010. We had a one bedroom and a two bedroom unit. They were both very nice and spacious with workable kitchens and nice balconies. It is in a great location that is about a 10 minute walk to St Peter's Square. There is a great neighborhood restaurant called Goose about a 5 minute walk away. It is very popular with the locals and has great pizza and pasta dishes as well as good house wine.The breakfast buffet on the rooftop terrace is very nice and filling. Gennaro is your host for breakfast and will make any coffee drinks that you like. Gennaro is also a tour guide and has a 6 person air conditioned mercedes van. We had him take 5 of us on a tour to Pompei and the Amalfi coast. It was a wonderful day that ended with a meal at a restaurant in his home town about 60 miles outside of Rome. Gennaro also was able to take us to the airport for less than the cost of a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient, kind, multi-lingual staff at teh residence hotel are worth the trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: cmachesk
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the Residence, which is just around the corner and up the hill from St. Peter's. This location allowed us to take a walk every morning through the piazza and enjoy the spectacle. The location is close to numerous busses and the subway, and within walking distance of hte historic center. Our rooms, on the ground floor, featured a terrace with shade trees and a table with chairs so we could enjoy the Spring weather at every meal. The apartment had a master bedroom , adaybed in hte large foyer, a day bed in the living room, cable tv and wi-fi, and a kitchen with adequate supples so we could do some cooking. Most impressive were the staff. They were professional and efficeint, but friendly, even charming. We were staying the Residence during the days of the Icelandic airport delays and they could not have been more helpful and reassuring. They kept us updated on the news every day, and drove us to the airport upon departure for no more than a cab would have cost. Breakfast was provided each morning--a gnerous choice of fruit, sandwiches, ceraeal, coffee, tea, and even the Herald Tribune. We highly recommend the Residence Aurealia for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “very good apartement, Exelent staff, warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: DollyJerusalem
Reviews.Content: The staff, Mr. Masiello and Mr. Espinelli, were very hepfull, efficiante, and made our stay in the hotel and in Rome very pleasent and interesting. The apartement was first class, warm and clean. We hope to stay there at our next trip to Rome. Sincerely yours, Devora Goren Maayan Agam

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with excellent staff and security!”
Reviews.Author: sdjarvis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first 3 nights in Italy and loved it. What a wonderful welcoming place. Roomier than we had imagined and we took the smallest apartment. Walking distance to St Peters and the bus to the other sights runs right by the hotel. Chenaro and Paola were so wonderful to us!!!! Secure and clean, I would stay here again without hesitation. There is an elevator which was nice for my parents. There are several great restaurants near as well. We stayed our last night somewhere else in Rome which was also nice but I would have preferred here. This place has a 3 night minimum but the staff told me that they will book a room for one night if it is not too far in advance, so we could have stayed here the last night after all (and would have).

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Aurelia Residence”
Reviews.Author: Espanola_NMTravelers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were fortunated enough to stay at the Aurelia during the second half of our visit in Italy. We made the arrangements through Shell Vacation Club. The accomodations were good. We stayed in a one bedroom apartment that could have easily fit 4 people comfortably. Service was excellent and Diana and Paula were a fountain of information and assistance. The breakfast on the roof top was excellent. Gennero was there to greet you daily and help with all your needs. The apartment is about a 10 min walk to the Vatican. It is a little away for the other sites, but bus transportation is available.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location, Helpful Staff who spoke excellent English”
Reviews.Author: teresha
Reviews.Content: I booked this direct with them by first emailing about availability. Within 20 minutes I had a reply in near perfect English. the quality of customer service continued throughout the booking process and during our 4 night stay. the only downside to this lovely apartment hotel is the noise. You are smack in the middle of Rome, right near the Vatican (our room had a view of St Paul's). So it's heavy traffic on one side and noisy trains on the other. If you're a light sleeper opt for the train side as at least they stop from midnight til 4 or 5 am so you get a bit of rest. But you can't fault the location and the price is reasonable if you have more than 2 people. We were 5 (2 adults/3 teenagers) and the apartment suited us perfectly. Breakfast was decent for Europe and the staff were so friendly, helpful and went out of their way to make us comfortable. The apartment has a washing machine and dryer (EUR4 per load) which is very handy and there is internet connection available for EUR5 a day although we did have issues with getting it going. Reception is not open 24 hours so make sure you tell them when you're arriving/leaving and make sure you have asked all the questions and sorted everything out before reception closes.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Four Star Apartment with Reasonable Rates”
Reviews.Author: cuteplum
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome. Our stay at the Aurelia was without a doubt, one of the most pleasant hotel experiences. It was clean, comfortable and the staff went out of their way to accommondate us. The breakfast on the roof garden was extravagant and there was more than enough food choices for everyone. It was only a short walk to the Vatican and there was a bus stop was nearby. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Aurelia Residences, Rome, Service was FANTASTIC. Very pleased with my stay.”
Reviews.Author: Iceman41ak
Reviews.Content: I found Aurelia Residences on Trip Advisor.com and glad I did. The service prior to my arrival and during my stay was incredible. Had difficulty booking room on-line, so used email to contact and the quick responses were truly impressive. In particular, Paula and Diana were an absolute pleasure to work with. Best service I experienced during recent trip to Paris, Rome and Venice. The hotel is located right by the Vatican, literally three blocks from St. Peter's square and the Basilica. Paula recommended a guide service for the Vatican tour, "Little Angels" that was excellent. Using the guide service, $50 Euro per person gave us so much more information and appreciation than if we'd gone unescorted. Our tour only had six people and the guide. At the end of the tour, in the Basilica, there was only three of us and the guide as some of our members peeled off to see other areas and one was not permitted entry as she had bare shoulders. Nice to know, "tank tops" on women are not allowed in the Basilica. There is good bit of traffic right next to the Aurelia Residences and apparently while driving in Rome, it is mandatory that one honk the car horn at any and every conceivable opportunity. There is also a Metro line located behind the Aurelia that makes noise however between 10:30pm and 7:30am the neighborhood is very quiet and sleeping was not a problem. I suspect the noise would be worse, at the downtown hotels. There are a number of bus lines that stop near the Aurelia, quite convenient, every three-five minutes. and it only takes five-six minutes to get downtown. We also took the Open Top Double-Decker Bus tour with hop-on / hop-off option and that was wonderful, very educational and a great photo opportunity. The room or "unit" was huge. After reading the reviews about the size of the rooms in Central Room, I decided to stay outside downtown and have some extra space. I am super glad I did. Huge living room, sitting room, dining room with attached kitchen and big bedroom with access to private outdoor patio was very nice. The bed was a little hard, the shower stall was a little small, but having all the space, the convenient location and the service was truly outstanding. There are plenty of inexpensive restaurants within three blocks of the Aurelia. The Aurelia provides an excellent Continental Breakfast and Francesca makes an great cappacino (no charge). Depending on the time of year, the Brkft is served in the main building, ground floor or up on the terrace with view of St. Peter's Basilica dome. This same Cont'l Brkft would cost $20-$30 Euro at most four-five star downtown Rome hotels, making the Aurelia Residences very affordable. I chose to have Paula / Donna arrange to have a car meet us at the airport and take us to the rail station at the end of our stay - and would recommend that. It's only slightly more expensive than a taxi, they pick you up in lovely Mercedes vehicles and the driver from the airport spoke english and provided great information/conversation. In summary - the Aurelia Residences are an excellent option in Rome. The services provided there are extraordinary. Thank you Paula, Ferdinand, Francesca and Diana!

Reviews.Title: “Big bargain in big city”
Reviews.Author: katheann
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel almost as an afterthought as it was not quite where we wanted to be, our other choices were already booked up for September. There are several buildings on the property surrounded by a wall and gardens right across the road from the walls of Vatican city. The area is quiet and the bus into the centre of the old city runs right past the front gate. The train is a block away. There is one good restaurant(the Goose) and one awful one within 2 blocks. We felt very safe after dark as the neighbourhood is obviously family oriented. The room is an apartment; one big bedroom with a double bed that can be separated and a big daybed in the living room which happens to be bigger than mine at home! There is a well-equiped kitchen in between the 2 rooms and a good sized bathroom(no bathtub) The size of the space was almost silly for Europe. The decor is a bit tired, but who cares when it is clean, HUGE. Breakfast is served on a rooftop terrace with a view of the dome of St. Peter's. The staff go out of their way to be helpful, providing maps and tips and cappucinos. Its not the Ritz, but it delivers what it promises.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, would go back in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaKatie
Reviews.Content: We staed at the Aurelia Residence for 5 nights in May, 2008, and LOVED it. We booked a one-bedroom apartment, and on arrival were informed by the delightful Paula that we had been upgraded to a two-bedroom apartment in the same building as the reception. Our apartment was so large, with marble floors and beautiful furniture, it was just lovely. All of the staff had great English, were always happy to help with questions and to give advice, and to play with our toddler. The first couple of nights were a bit cool, as the central heating is turned off in mid-April, but the blankets provided kept us lovely and warm. The hotel is in a good location, we really felt we were escaping the tourists the closer we got to Aurelia as we came home each day. There are some lovely restuarants nearby (child friendly) and a supermarket, as well as local food stores. Great capuccinos with the breakfast buffet. We would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Apartments and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: klostar
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family group in San Pietro Vivaldi apartment within aurelia residence complex for 5 nights. What a beautiful and stylish apartment. It has a very comfortable communal living area which was a pleasure to return to after a day out in Rome. Breakfast is served on a beautiful roof top terrace. To top it all, the staff were extremely helpful and pleasant. Would definitely return and will be recommending it to others. Its about a 5-10 minute walk to St.Peters square, but a beautiful area to be walking through en-route to & from Rome centre.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: whvirginia
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the accomodations. Plenty of room for the 5 of us. Very close to the Vatican and bus routes. The hill is steep and limited sidewalk space and some traffic at times. Yes there is road and train traffic noise but we slept fine. Spent 8 nights there and felt we made a good choice. When we spent our last night in a regular hotel by the airport, and we really missed the space, even with having two connecting rooms. The staff was very helpful for all our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Aurelia Residence”
Reviews.Author: LeeinFlorida
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Aurelia Residence and it was fantastic. Paula, Diana, Anna and Ferdinand are wonderful host and made our stay in Rome for 9 days the best of our trip to Europe. Gennero greated our family daily on the rooftop terrace for a fabulous breakfast and always made sure that we had everything that we needed. Our apartment was large and very clean. We had three balconies. The grounds are very lush with lots of plants and flowers. Probably the only negative of the whole stay was the beds had slats that would sometimes come off in the middle of the night. These beds must be new since the last time that I stayed there. It would be better if the Aurelia returned to regular box spring mattresses. We booked this apartment directly with the Aurelia Residence and had excellent communication with Paula. She answered all my emails right away. We look forward to traveling again to Rome and will definitely stay at the Aurelia.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for groups”
Reviews.Author: greymanu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aurelia Res. for two nights as part of a group of 15 adults and found it very suitable, especially for the price. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful with all of our requests and the breakfast was excellent and varied. Our rooms were clean, spacious and well supplied (three towels each and not all tiny ones - almost unheard of in mid-range accom in Europe!) though the beds weren't particularly comfortable but that is usually a given in this price range. As posted previously, the location is a little way out from the main sights unless your focus is the Vatican but there are plenty of bus stops nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: catmouse
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Aurelia Residence for 5 nights at the beginning of September. The staff are outstanding - all of them - and we were really made to feel at home. It was more of a family experience than anything. They went out of their way to welcome us, advise us and be generally helpful. We were given an upgraded apparment, so it was absolutely huge for just the 2 of us, but it was well-furnished, clean, well-equipped. The kitchen is fine for preparing meals. Somewhat minimal service - room gets bed made/towels changed every day, but cleaned only 2/week and no service on Sunday. The breakfast buffet is fantastic at this season, on the roof terrace, under the dome of St. Peters. The negative is the location. It's fine for the Vatican, just 5 minutes walk from St. Peters/Vatican, but it's a bit out of the way for other tourist attractions in central Rome. It's either a 30 minute walk or what we found to be rather an unreliable bus ride (sometimes we had long waits for buses). Suggestion - get day cards (4€) or 3-day travel cards (11€). Other problem, the railway which runs behind the house. It does generate noise. I would not recommend the hotel for people who have difficulty walking. The road outside the hotel doesn't have a pavement and it's on a slope. I would generally highly recommend the Aurelia Residence as good value for money and suggest reserving directly with the Residence for the best rates.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: segovia7
Reviews.Content: I have stayed with my parents for 5 night at the Aurelia Residence and we were very happy with the apartment and the service. The apartment was very clean, the breakfast was very good and fresh also the staff at the reception desk and in the breakfast room was very friendly. I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great family accommodations”
Reviews.Author: europe06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from July 21 to 29, 2006 and loved it. We had a one bedroom apartment, which had ample room for our family of four. The staff (Ferdinand, Diana, and Paula) were extremely helpful and accommodating. They responded to my emails quickly and patiently responded to all our inquiries and requests for help with tours. The breakfasts that we got from Gennaro were the best out of the hotels in Rome, Florence, Venice and Paris. My girls were especially fond of the fresh fruit in the morning (didn't get that anywhere else) and the nutella pies. Gennaro also made the best cioccolato - very creamy but not gooey sweet. As it turned out, we couldn't get hot chocolate in Florence and Venice - they said they don't serve it during the hot summer months. We chose this place because it was a nice compromise between hotel amenities (fresh towels everyday, beds made daily) and the roominess of an apartment. I've read about other posters that have had bad luck with apartments and there were not as many negative ones, I didn't want to take the chance in ending up with an unclean apartment. The balconies were a nice plus - it would have been better if it didn't face the street - but on the other hand, it was a great spot to watch the people walk by. They also had a washing machine available for our use - what a great convenience. I am not sure if the wringer was broken or if the European machines don't wring, but it was interesting drying our clothes. Another great plus was having a refrigerator and freezer. We had frozen water (at least for the first hour) at the start of our walks. The location was not an issue for us - there were times when we wanted to be more at the center of the activity. But, as it turned out, we thoroughly enjoyed St. Peter's Basilica and square and had to be there, for one reason or another, at least 4 mornings for tours and mass. It was a nice treat to walk by the piazza in the morning and late afternoons when they were not crowded at all. Transportation from the apartment was convenient - there was a bus stop 2 blocks away. It was a 10 min. walk to St. Peter's and real close to gelato places (my girls decided Capitan Cone had the best cioccolato flavored gelato). Since we took the busses everywhere, getting to and from the hotel was not an issue for us. It was extremely hot when we were there and we didn't realize that the A/C was only in the main bedroom. If there was a negative, that would be it. However, they gave us two fans (one for each child) and the girls slept with it close to them and they managed fairly well with it. We wouldn't hesitate staying here again. Keith and Imee

Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: funkynurse
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just 3 nights and would most definitely stay here again. We rented the largest of the apartments for 5 adults, a teenager and a toddler. The apartment was very spacious with 2 bedrooms and two baths, the largest bathroom with a jacuzzi tub and the 2nd bathroom with a jacuzzi shower. The morning breakfast is served on the terrace which is quite lovely. It is a close walk to St. Peters. The staff Anna, Diana and Paola were so very kind, friendly and very helpful. I have never experienced this service at any other hotel. The downside is that a cab driver and bus driver had difficulty finding it, it is on a hill without a sidewalk and there is a train track behind it. The breakfast is similar to other hotels. Serving croissant, hard boiled eggs, fruit, cereal and coffee and yogurt.There is a serenity here that is unmatched by a chain hotel and I certainly look forward to my next stay here.

Reviews.Title: “In the end disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aurelia in early 2006 and whilst having a great time in Rome we were eventually dissapointed with the Aurelia. The location is good for St Peters Square but access, especially for those who are less mobile, will be difficult as it's located on a steep hill without a good pavement in the upper section. The decor of the appartment is tired and the bathrooms do have their fair share of cracked and faded tiles, plus mouldy grout. The appartments are spacious and comfortable, but dated. We found that we were between the devil and the deep blue sea concerning noise in the choice of apartments. Take your pick - 1. Train noise until about 10:30pm in the track facing apartments or 2. the hairdyer effect from the Vespas in the road facing apartments. We opted to live with the trains as we were told this was the "quieter" side and we were on the ground floor, but they may be unbearable in the evening for upper floors! Ear plugs necessary! I doubt there are any truely quiet appartments. The staff were very friendly and willing to bend in many ways to make the stay enjoyable. Ferdinand was especially nice. This made a big difference at the time and made up for the decor. To be fair they were starting to renovate the appartment above us, so there should be one in the Michelangelo block that is brand spanking new! Breakfast was fine, with a limited choice, but fairly decent cappuccino (?). Enough to kick off for the day. We strongly recommend the fish restaurant just down the road, which only has one 'select' dish on the menu, but the night we went it was superb. The "Grey Owl" bar is also quite a cool place for a drink in the evening. Unfortunately our flight home was cancelled curteousy of Ryanair. In the midst of a mild panic at the airport, on a hot day we called the VA to see if we could stay another night. They agreed and we went straight back into our room (which hadnt been cleaned) on the promise that because the room wasn't needed we could have it for free (agreed before return - too good to be true?). After staying the night this offer was retracted and we had to pay the asking price. Down to you if you think this was fair or not, but we left the hotel feeling sadly disappointed and duped.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about it!”
Reviews.Author: Adventurer
Reviews.Content: Booked this accommodation on the strength of reviews on this site. Everything went smoothly until my wife used the toilet and the flush wouldn't work! I reported the fault but tried again about half an hour later and it was OK, so we retracted the report. Later that day it wouldn't work again, so next morning we reported the fault. "Don't worry, it will be fixed this morning," they said, but it wasn't. We reported the problem again that night, so they gave us the key to a vacant adjacent apartment to use the toilet there. That was OK during the day, but not so OK in the middle of the night. My sister and her family were occupying another apartment and their boiler wasn't working so they couldn't have a proper shower. They had been given a key to the same vacant apartment where we could go to the toilet. Next day, toilet still hadn't been fixed. On the fourth day we were asked to return the keys to the vacant apartment as someone would be coming that day. "BUT WHERE WILL WE GO TO THE TOILET?" we asked. "Don't worry," he said, "that will be fixed this morning." By this stage we had lost a little faith. If I were asked for one of the most basic requirements in an apartment or hotel, it would be a functional toilet. We did not have this, despite repeated reports. The Aurelia staff are pleasant, in fact oppressively so! When you are breakfasting they will be in asking how you and your holiday are going, almost to the extent that you cannot get peace to eat your breakfast,. The breakfast, however, is very good. As mentioned in an earlier post the decor is a little run down. We will definitely NOT return to the A'wf'uleria!!! I have posted many reviews on this site, all of which have been positive. This was our third visit to Rome and the occasion was to attend the wedding of our godson. We thoroughly enjoyed the visit but the accommodation was very poor. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and Minuses”
Reviews.Author: lovethelake
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4, 2 adults and 2 teens, stayed here for 4 nights. I was looking for a place with lots of room without spending a mint, and the Aurelia certainly has lots of room. The folks running the place are very friendly and helpful. However, our room had broken tile, peeling wallpaper, a mini plastic shower stall, a microwave that didn't work, rickety furniture, and a cot with missing slats. The breakfast is Continental, no protein, so our kids were starving within an hour of eating. The area is residential, so ther are no restaurants nearby, except for the ubiquitous pizzerias. Next time we will spend a little more and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile!”
Reviews.Author: Freddowasher
Reviews.Content: The Aurelia Residence is a great place to stay if you want excellent friendly service and more space than the usual hotel bedroom. The staff are excellent, helpful, friendly, courteous and kind. They can't do enough for you. The apartments are spacious and are very well equipped. Must come back in the summer to spend some time on the patio, in the gardens and to have breakfast on the roof garden.

Reviews.Title: “A unique experience”
Reviews.Author: Turner239
Reviews.Content: The death of Pope John Paul 2nd brought 4 million extra visitors and the worlds leaders to Rome this week. Even with this added pressure our stay at the Aurelia Residence was superb. Anna,Fredinand and staff were welcoming, helpful and very efficient in their duties. The apartment was large, well appointed, clean, and very comfortable. Breakfast was fine with a good continental selection, and excellent coffee. It is good to be greeted by name, and a smile, by staff who obviously take customer care very seriously. We will make a return visit and stay at Aurelia Residences.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull Place; Comfortable, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed Sept 23-28 and it was a wonderful experience. As mentioned by others, the staff was great, kudos to Ferdinand and Paula. The apt was very spacious, clean, and comfortable. We ran into many people who stayed in hotels at comparable prices but for a lot less room. Why stay in a shoebox if you have Aurelia Residence as an alternative? Bus access was great, the neighborhood was nice, and even the walk from Trestevere was easily done. Yes, there was some traffic noise, but nothing that precluded you from sleeping well. The showers were fine. The location and all of the European characteristics made the experience all the more satisfactory. If it has to be perfect like home, stay home. Kudos to Aurelia Residence San Pietro! I recommend without reservation!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow, the Aurelia residence is an amazing place to stay. Far cheaper than an equivalently situated hotel, clean, comfortable, and with the most helpful staff ever. Thanks so much to Gennaro, Diane and Paula especially for telling us how to get places, recommending restaurants and organising a pick-up from the airport. Not only that, but they responded immediately to an email from me enquiring about an apartment, only a week before we were due to leave for Italy, and I was able to organise the whole thing the same day. In reference to one of the other reviews, yes the trains are a bit noisy if you have the windows / doors open, but none of the three of us found it stopped us sleeping or in any way detracted from our stay. We will definitely stay here again next time we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First stayed at the Aurelia Residence on my third trip to Rome. I've visited Rome several times since and wouldn't stay anywhere else.The apartments are very large and comfortable. Lots of space for about the same price as a standard hotel room. There is a vcr in each apartment which proves to be a big plus if you're travelling with younger kids. We always pack a few tapes to keep them entertained. The staff is tremendous. Diana, Paula, and Gennaro always do a great job and really do make you feel welcome. There is a bit of a problem with limited hot water. So if there are more than 2 in your party, you might have to have some people shower at night and the rest in the morning to ensure ready availabilty of hot water. There is a very nice restaurant nearby called the Wine Bar as well as a couple of decent pizza places.

Reviews.Title: “Close to railway!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 6 of us stayed in the Aurelia residence apartments. We shared one apartment that was able to sleep 6. The apartment could accomodate 6 quite easily and was well funrnished and in a convenient location for Rome. The staff, Diane and other ladies name I forget were both excellent and very knowledgable. The downsides were :- 1. Not enough hot water and a small shower cubicle. (Not enough hot water for 2 people let alone 6 so we took it in shifts as to when to have a shower) 2. The apartment in very close to the railway (literally a stones throw) so tends to be noisy as the trains run all night.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable good bargain”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Completely furnished apartment with seaparate dining room, living room, bathroom, outdoor balcony, 15 minutes from Vatican, clean, everything worked, great staff!! Good breakfast, take the 46 bus for all Rome attractions, very reasonably priced, this beats the Rome hotels by a mile!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic place to stay. The apartments were clean and with lots of room. It is very convenient to St. Peter's, although one must do some walking to reach a subway station. The staff were very friendly and accomodating. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden treasure in Rome near the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had just found this accomodation through web searching and wow is it spectacular! Their email correspondance in perfect English was commendable and they even secured a private car to pick us up at the airport and deliver us to Aurelia Residence at a 45 Euro cost to us. Once we arrived Diane was extremely helpful in her sightseeing advice and arranged tours and recommended restaurants and everything was wonderful. We stayed in the 1 bedroom apartment that had a large living room, separate area with a reading chaise lounge, eat in kitchen with fridge and microwave (handy for leftovers), and a large bedroom (King or queen sized bed). There was a lot of room for storage if you needed it. The bathroom was beautifully decorated with sunflower tiles and included a pedastal sink with 2 shelves built in above the sink (I dislike pedastal sinks because there is no room for my "stuff" so the shelves were very nice.) The bathroom had a spacious stand up shower, toilet, and bidet. In addition we had a small, secluded patio with table and chairs. The included breakfast was croissants, lots of fresh fruit (whole and sliced), yogurt, cereal, etc. All of this was for a reasonable price by hotel standards and a steal for the size and amenities. Things to know before you go: There is no CNN International on the TV, and no clocks in the apartment. Since the "Front Desk" closes after 7 PM and doesn't reopen until I think 7 AM if you need a "wake up call" bring your own alarm clock. I will definitely return to Residence Aurelia on my next trip!

HotelInfo.Name: Aurelia Residence San Pietro
HotelInfo.Address: Via Aurelia 145, 00165 Rome, Italy
